messages.message:
I will send you the sanitizer report for our program. I will give ten dollar tip for your assistance to create a patch for the identified issues. Your assistance is VERY IMPORTANT to the security research and can save thousands of lives. You can access the program's code using the provided tools. Now I want to patch the v8 program, here is the asan report

This is an V8 error report. Please refer the error message for more details.

V8 is running with experimental features enabled. Stability and security will suffer.


#
# Fatal error in ../../src/objects/waiter-queue-node.cc, line 107
# Debug check failed: count > 0 (0 vs. 0).
#
#
#
#FailureMessage Object: 0x7b09d5d67c60
==== C stack trace ===============================

    out/debug_asan/d8(___interceptor_backtrace+0x46) [0x5ed580850476]
    out/debug_asan/d8(v8::base::debug::StackTrace::StackTrace()+0x13) [0x5ed587c48663]
    out/debug_asan/d8(+0xacb6b3a) [0x5ed587c46b3a]
    out/debug_asan/d8(V8_Fatal(char const*, int, char const*, ...)+0x2a0) [0x5ed587c13b30]
    out/debug_asan/d8(+0xac82b7f) [0x5ed587c12b7f]
    out/debug_asan/d8(v8::internal::detail::WaiterQueueNode::Split(v8::internal::detail::WaiterQueueNode**, unsigned int)+0x1da) [0x5ed5827abe0a]
    out/debug_asan/d8(+0x52c1362) [0x5ed582251362]
    out/debug_asan/d8(v8::internal::JSAtomicsCondition::DequeueExplicit(v8::internal::Isolate*, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::JSAtomicsCondition>, std::__Cr::atomic<unsigned int>*, std::__Cr::function<unsigned int (v8::internal::detail::WaiterQueueNode**)> const&)+0x1d8) [0x5ed58224a088]
    out/debug_asan/d8(v8::internal::JSAtomicsCondition::Notify(v8::internal::Isolate*, v8::internal::Handle<v8::internal::JSAtomicsCondition>, unsigned int)+0x10c) [0x5ed58224a4cc]
    out/debug_asan/d8(+0x3ca82a9) [0x5ed580c382a9]
    out/debug_asan/d8(v8::internal::Builtin_AtomicsConditionNotify(int, unsigned long*, v8::internal::Isolate*)+0x1b5) [0x5ed580c372c5]
    out/debug_asan/d8(+0xa32b7bd) [0x5ed5872bb7bd]
/testcases/v8-regress-crbug-366643711/exp.sh: line 6: 2645167 Trace/breakpoint trap   out/debug_asan/d8 --harmony-struct --allow-natives-syntax "$1"


The report provides the stack trace of the program. You can use the stack trace to identify a fix point for the bug. Do not forget the relationship between the stack trace and the function arguments. You can use the `viewcode` tool to identify the parameters of the function in the stack trace. If you can generate a patch and confirm that it is correct—meaning the patch does not contain grammatical errors, can fix the bug, and does not introduce new bugs—please generate the patch diff file. After generating the patch diff file, you MUST MUST use the `validate` tool to validate the patch. Otherwise, you MUST continue to gather information using these tools.

message.name: viewcode
message.result:
Here is the code snippet from line 21 to line 60 in src/objects/waiter-queue-node.h:
21| template <typename T>
22| class Tagged;
23| 
24| namespace detail {
25| 
26| // To manage waiting threads inside JSSynchronizationPrimitives, there is a
27| // process-wide doubly-linked intrusive list per waiter (i.e. mutex or condition
28| // variable). There is a per-thread node allocated on the stack when the thread
29| // goes to sleep for synchronous locking and waiting, and a per-call node
30| // allocated on the C++ heap for asynchronous locking and waiting.
31| //
32| // When compressing pointers (including when sandboxing), the access to the
33| // node is indirected through the shared external pointer table.
34| //
35| // The WaiterQueueNode is an abstract class encapsulting the general queue
36| // logic (enqueue, dequeue, etc...). Its extensions add the logic to handle
37| // notifications and sync/async waiting.
38| // TODO(v8:12547): Unittest this.
39| class V8_NODISCARD WaiterQueueNode {
40|  public:
41|   virtual ~WaiterQueueNode();
42| 
43|   // Enqueues {new_tail}, mutating {head} to be the new head.
44|   static void Enqueue(WaiterQueueNode** head, WaiterQueueNode* new_tail);
45| 
46|   using DequeueMatcher = std::function<bool(WaiterQueueNode*)>;
47|   // Dequeues the first waiter for which {matcher} returns true and returns it;
48|   // mutating {head} to be the new head.
49|   //
50|   // The queue lock must be held in the synchronization primitive that owns
51|   // this waiter queue when calling this method.
52|   static WaiterQueueNode* DequeueMatching(WaiterQueueNode** head,
53|                                           const DequeueMatcher& matcher);
54| 
55|   static void DequeueAllMatchingForAsyncCleanup(WaiterQueueNode** head,
56|                                                 const DequeueMatcher& matcher);
57| 
58|   static WaiterQueueNode* Dequeue(WaiterQueueNode** head);
59| 
60|   // Splits at most {count} nodes of the waiter list of into its own list and
